rComments: Curtis is an excellent professor and speaker. His course was a great experience for me as he made the material very interesting and captivating. His lectures are very organized and and his explanations are very clear and engaging. He is also very approachable and is always there for his students. I highly recommend taking a course with Curtis.

Curtis is a passionate lecturer and his classes were genuinely enjoyable.  This is more than your average history class; his enthusiasm is contagious. Clear course structure, both breadth and depth in subject matter, very fair exams and assignments, light on readings but classes demand your full attention.  Would highly recommend!
teacherRatingTags: ['Inspirational', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Curtis is a very pleasant speaker and has a great sense of humour.   However, not having a course textbook or more consistent readings, or sufficient information on the slides, made this class unnecessarily stressful.  Luckily students shared notes on Facebook.  I took part two of Scientific Revolutions last year and found it much easier.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Accessible outside class', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: I found Curtis' lectures very interesting and captivating. I feel I developed a passion for the subject in just a semester of attending his lectures. Great lecturer with a good sense of humor and really cares about his students. Best Prof I have had at UofT in the 5 years I've been here.

Despite the instructor being on strike against the university for several weeks, he attempted to minimize the disruptions to the class, and tried to keep us informed about the situation (much better than what the university did anyways). Great to talk to, never looks down on you for bringing up an idea, open minded, clear and decently easy marker.

Curtis was one of the better professors I had at the university in another class. I took this one because he was teaching it and he didn't disappoint at all. The subject material was very clearly discussed during class, you knew what to expect. Excellent professor, would highly recommend. Textbook was all online material, so it was free.
EXCELLENT speaker; often doesn't post slides so you better take notes. No textbook, readings posted online.
I thought it gonna be more interesting. But every lecture i fall asleep and the tutorial is not helpful either

Curtis is really entrenched in the philosophy of science literature. Knows the field inside out. Delightfully enthusiastic about it. Amusing but thorough lectures. Fair grader.  Cannot stress enough how detailed and helpful Curtis' grading and feedback is. Highlight: I received 400 words of feedback via email for the final paper proposal.

I thought Curtis did a great job in this course. I took this course for a science credit but I ended up enjoying the course. Curtis explained all the course material very clearly and he was enthusiastic. I would take another course with Curtis again. He is a great prof and all the marking for the course was fair.
Good prof, engaging lectures, actually cares about the class and students. Heavy on the blackboard stuff, posts a lot online. Overall one of the best profs I've had thus far.
great prof, funny and engaging
Forbes delivers a casual, organized, and interactive presentation. He clearly possesses in-depth knowledge of history and its meanings. His enthusiasm seized my attention from beginning to end.
Highly recommended!   His lectures were clearly organized and he made excellent use of slides.  Also, he is very funny.

Great guy - I had a great experience with the course - very organized and on the ball. He spoonfeeds a bit due to very detailed lecture notes, but the truth is that he is very concerned about his students understanding dense material. Great Course for distribution requirement, would recommend it! Curtis is also very smart!
Highly recommended! An excellent professor, very humorous and explains concepts very clearly.  Also a nice guys and very helpful.

Did not like the course due to the professor. I'm an HPS major in my third year, and I really feel cheated due to the way lectures were handled. He asked us to write a review for him on blackboard, so, I'm doing just that. Curtis seems best suited to doing research, I think he should stay away from lecturing.
An excellent professor! I enjoyed all of his lectures.  Very humorous and explained everything very clearly. He's also a very nice guy and very helpful.  Highly recommended!

Curtis is a really good professor.  He turned an otherwise boring subject into a fun course!  Very humorous and explains everything very clearly.  He is also a very friendly and helpful person.  Highly recommended!
He is a really good professor: humorous and explains everything very clearly.  I really enjoyed his lectures.

Curtis was a great professor! His lectures were clearly organized and he made excellent use of slides. Integrating a number of guest lecturers was a great way to keep students engaged and provided us with an alternate perspectives. I genuinely think that he is on the students' side and truly wants all of us to succeed! Very helpful, A+ prof!

Delightful experience. Instructor Forbes's lectures are clearly organized. Having guess lecturers adds more dynamics to the course.The total mark is divided more reasonably by having tutorial and assignment, contrary to the HPS210. Curtis is very approachable and answer student's questions straight-forwardly.Hightly recommend it to other students.
